text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention that US courts apply the \"manifest disregard of the law\" doctrine only in domestic arbitration and not in foreign award enforcement under the New York Convention. The candidate answer discusses due process arguments under Article V and cites *Mitsubishi* regarding the standard for setting aside an award, but it never explicitly addresses or mentions the \"manifest disregard of the law\" doctrine in the context of foreign award enforcement under the NYC, nor does it state that this doctrine is inapplicable to foreign awards.", "criterion_id": "0b829d90-0ded-4a7c-9508-72d4252c8baa"}
